section.title: Present Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Continuous to talk about activities that are happening now. The Present Continuous is to be + -ing.
section.text2a: We aren't staying at home today.
section.sectiontitle2: Put to be before the subject pronoun to make questions. Use the verb to be in short answers.
section.text3a: Is he eating dinner at the moment?
section.text4: Are you doing your homework now?
section.text4a: Yes, I am. / No, I'm not.

section.title: Present Continuous
section.sectiontitle: Some verbs change when we add -ing.
section.text1: I cycle to work every day.
section.text1a: I'm cycling in the gym at the moment.
section.text2: The dogs often dig in the garden.
section.text2a: They're digging by the tree now.

section.title: Adverbs of manner
section.sectiontitle: Adverbs of manner describe the action of the verb. They usually come after the verb and after any other words that are linked to the verb.
section.text2a: They're filling in the form carelessly.
section.sectiontitle2: Add -ly to most adjectives to make adverbs. When the adjective ends in -y, remove the -y and add -ily.
